At that day shall a man look to his Maker. After the troubles, disasters, and depopulation of the land, at least some of those who remain will repent of their sins and return to God, looking to him with new "respect."

Maker. Isaiah contrasts man and Maker; man is weak, frail, and dependent compared to the Maker, who is the Creator, Omnipotent, and Lord of all. Verse 8 continues the contrast when Isaiah reproves mankind for vainly creating idols with his own tools ("the work of his hands") rather than relying upon God (the Maker), who created him.
